trans-unit.source: How to manage Virtual Network (VNet) Properties
trans-unit.target: How to manage Virtual Network (VNet) Properties

trans-unit.source: Learn how to view and edit virtual network settings
trans-unit.target: Learn how to view and edit virtual network settings

trans-unit.source: How to manage Virtual Network (VNet) Properties
trans-unit.target: How to manage Virtual Network (VNet) Properties

trans-unit.source: You can view and modify VNet settings by using the management portal.
trans-unit.target: You can view and modify VNet settings by using the management portal.

trans-unit.source: View VNet settings
trans-unit.target: View VNet settings

trans-unit.source: Log on to the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click Networks, and then click the VNet name in the Name column.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane, click Networks, and then click the VNet name in the Name column.

trans-unit.source: Click Dashboard to view the following information:
trans-unit.target: Click Dashboard to view the following information:

trans-unit.source: virtual network: This is the virtual network and subnets along with the local network and DNS server.
trans-unit.target: virtual network: This is the virtual network and subnets along with the local network and DNS server.

trans-unit.source: data in, data out: Visible when you have cross-premises connectivity.
trans-unit.target: data in, data out: Visible when you have cross-premises connectivity.

trans-unit.source: This is the data coming into and going out of your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: This is the data coming into and going out of your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: gateway IP address: Visible when you have configured a gateway.
trans-unit.target: gateway IP address: Visible when you have configured a gateway.

trans-unit.source: This is the gateway IP address.
trans-unit.target: This is the gateway IP address.

trans-unit.source: This is the IP address that you will use to configure your VPN device for cross-premise connectivity.
trans-unit.target: This is the IP address that you will use to configure your VPN device for cross-premise connectivity.

trans-unit.source: resources: These are the Azure resources connected to this virtual network.
trans-unit.target: resources: These are the Azure resources connected to this virtual network.

trans-unit.source: quick glance: A place to quickly find the following information:
trans-unit.target: quick glance: A place to quickly find the following information:

trans-unit.source: Download Client VPN package: This package is used when creating point-to-site cross premises VPN connections.
trans-unit.target: Download Client VPN package: This package is used when creating point-to-site cross premises VPN connections.

trans-unit.source: Download the package that pertains to the client.
trans-unit.target: Download the package that pertains to the client.

trans-unit.source: Download VPN device script: These templates are used to help configure VPN devices for site-to-site cross-premises connections.
trans-unit.target: Download VPN device script: These templates are used to help configure VPN devices for site-to-site cross-premises connections.

trans-unit.source: status
trans-unit.target: status

trans-unit.source: subscription ID
trans-unit.target: subscription ID

trans-unit.source: virtual network ID
trans-unit.target: virtual network ID

trans-unit.source: location
trans-unit.target: location

trans-unit.source: Click Configure to view the following information:
trans-unit.target: Click Configure to view the following information:

trans-unit.source: dns servers: These are the DNS servers and their corresponding IP address that the clients in your virtual network will use for name resolution.
trans-unit.target: dns servers: These are the DNS servers and their corresponding IP address that the clients in your virtual network will use for name resolution.

trans-unit.source: point-to-site connectivity: Visible when you have configured your virtual network for point-to-site connections.
trans-unit.target: point-to-site connectivity: Visible when you have configured your virtual network for point-to-site connections.

trans-unit.source: site-to-site connectivity: Visible when you have configured your virtual network for site-to-site connections.
trans-unit.target: site-to-site connectivity: Visible when you have configured your virtual network for site-to-site connections.

trans-unit.source: local network: This is shown if you have site-to-site connectivity.
trans-unit.target: local network: This is shown if you have site-to-site connectivity.

trans-unit.source: This is selected local network that represents your on-premises site.
trans-unit.target: This is selected local network that represents your on-premises site.

trans-unit.source: The settings for this local network can be configured in networks on the Local Networks page.
trans-unit.target: The settings for this local network can be configured in networks on the Local Networks page.

trans-unit.source: virtual network address spaces: The address space and subnets in your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: virtual network address spaces: The address space and subnets in your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Click Certificates to view the following information:
trans-unit.target: Click Certificates to view the following information:

trans-unit.source: Uploaded root certificate: For point-to-site VPN configurations
trans-unit.target: Uploaded root certificate: For point-to-site VPN configurations

trans-unit.source: Certificate thumbprint
trans-unit.target: Certificate thumbprint

trans-unit.source: Certificate expiration
trans-unit.target: Certificate expiration

trans-unit.source: Upload: Upload a root certificate
trans-unit.target: Upload: Upload a root certificate

trans-unit.source: Delete: Delete a selected root certificate
trans-unit.target: Delete: Delete a selected root certificate

trans-unit.source: Edit VNet settings
trans-unit.target: Edit VNet settings

trans-unit.source: After you deploy your virtual network, only certain settings can be modified.
trans-unit.target: After you deploy your virtual network, only certain settings can be modified.

trans-unit.source: The following steps will help you edit your virtual network configuration settings using the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The following steps will help you edit your virtual network configuration settings using the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Log on to the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click Networks, and then click the Virtual Network name in the Name column.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane, click Networks, and then click the Virtual Network name in the Name column.

trans-unit.source: Click Configure.
trans-unit.target: Click Configure.

trans-unit.source: In dns servers, you can add additional DNS servers for name resolution.
trans-unit.target: In dns servers, you can add additional DNS servers for name resolution.

trans-unit.source: If you add additional DNS servers after you have deployed virtual machines to your virtual network, you must restart each virtual machine in order for it to pick up the new additional DNS server.
trans-unit.target: If you add additional DNS servers after you have deployed virtual machines to your virtual network, you must restart each virtual machine in order for it to pick up the new additional DNS server.

trans-unit.source: In the point-to-site connectivity section, you can configure the address space that you want to designate for point-to-site connections.
trans-unit.target: In the point-to-site connectivity section, you can configure the address space that you want to designate for point-to-site connections.

trans-unit.source: In the site to site connectivity section, you can configure site-to-site settings.
trans-unit.target: In the site to site connectivity section, you can configure site-to-site settings.

trans-unit.source: In the virtual network address space section, you can add additional address space and subnets.
trans-unit.target: In the virtual network address space section, you can add additional address space and subnets.

trans-unit.source: To add subnets, click add subnets and configure the address space that you want to use.
trans-unit.target: To add subnets, click add subnets and configure the address space that you want to use.

trans-unit.source: To add a gateway subnet for cross-premises connectivity, click add gateway subnet.
trans-unit.target: To add a gateway subnet for cross-premises connectivity, click add gateway subnet.

trans-unit.source: You can only add one gateway subnet per virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You can only add one gateway subnet per virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE at the bottom of the screen to save your configuration changes.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE at the bottom of the screen to save your configuration changes.

trans-unit.target: Next Steps
